newsitem.title: UK: Whitbread rises as Merrill reiterates buy.
newsitem.headline: Whitbread rises as Merrill reiterates buy.

text.p: Shares in Whitbread Plc rose on Wednesday after Merrill Lynch repeated its buy recommendation on the British brewing to leisure group.
"We feel it's mis-understood," said John Beaumont, analyst at Merrill Lynch, highlighting its pub chain's exposure to improving consumer spending in Britain.
Whitbread's shares were trading at 718 pence, up 11 pence at 0928 GMT.
"And even though it's third place in brewing it's also running very well there," said Beaumont.
Whitbread's share price incurred losses after it paid 133 million stg for the Pelican restaurant chain last month but Beaumont said this deal would add value in year two.
Whitbread's hotel division is also trading well, he said.
